details.overview: Samsung Galaxy M21 smartphone runs on Android v10 (Q) operating system. The phone is powered by Octa core (2.3 GHz, Quad core, Cortex A73 + 1.7 GHz, Quad core, Cortex A53) processor. It runs on the Samsung Exynos 9 Octa 9611 Chipset. It has 4 GB RAM and 64 GB internal storage.
Samsung Galaxy M30s is the latest offering by the South Korean brand under the Galaxy M series. The smartphone is one of the biggest battery phones in India. It packs 6000mAh battery.

Samsung Galaxy M31 smartphone runs on Android v10 (Q) operating system. The phone is powered by Octa core (2.3 GHz, Quad core, Cortex A73 + 1.7 GHz, Quad core, Cortex A53) processor. It runs on the Samsung Exynos 9 Octa 9611 Chipset. It has 6 GB RAM and 64 GB internal storage.

Xiaomi Redmi Note 8 smartphone runs on Android v9.0 (Pie) operating system. The phone is powered by Octa core (2 GHz, Quad core, Kryo 260 + 1.8 GHz, Quad core, Kryo 260) processor. It runs on the Qualcomm Snapdragon 665 Chipset. It has 4 GB RAM and 64 GB internal storage.

Redmi Note 9 Pro is a true performer in every department. Available in two variants like 4GB RAM + 64GB storage and 6GB RAM + 128 storage, its price in India starts from Rs 13,999. The color options available are like Glacier White, Aurora Blue, and Interstellar Black. Also, it comes with a brilliantly glossy panel of Gorilla Glass 5.

Xiaomi Mi Note 10 Pro smartphone runs on Android v9.0 (Pie) operating system. The phone is powered by Octa core (2.2 GHz, Dual core, Kryo 470 + 1.8 GHz, Hexa Core, Kryo 470) processor. It runs on the Qualcomm Snapdragon 730G Chipset. It has 8 GB RAM and 256 GB internal storage.

Apple iPhone 6 16GB smartphone runs on iOS v8 operating system. The phone is powered by Dual core, 1.4 GHz, Cyclone processor. It runs on the Apple A8 APL1011 Chipset. It has 1 GB RAM and 16 GB internal storage.

Apple launched iPhone 7 Plus in India in October last year in Silver, Gold, Rose Gold, Black colour options in 32GB, 128GB and 256GB storage variants. The phone has a bigger screen as compared to previous iPhone. It sports a 5.5-inch Retina HD display with 3D touch and a screen resolution of 1080 x 1920 pixels. The smartphone is powered by a new quad-core 2.37 GHz Apple A10 Fusion processor, which the company claims is 40 per cent faster than the previous version.

Apple iPhone 8 Plus smartphone runs on iOS v11 operating system. The phone is powered by Hexa Core (2.39 GHz, Dual core, Monsoon + 1.42 GHz, Quad core, Mistral) processor. It runs on the Apple A11 Bionic Chipset. It has 3 GB RAM and 64 GB internal storage.
